origination.corpname: Indiana University. College of Arts and Sciences. Policy Committee.

did.abstract: The Policy Committee of the College and Arts and Sciences was established in 1942 to undertake the investigation of particular issues affecting faculty and students within the College. This group was meant to be a policy-forming, advisory body that determined "both the policies of the College in its relationship with other departments of the University and the general policy of the College itself." The Collection consists of minutes and general documents for this committee, spanning the period from its inception in 1942 to 1998.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Select files closed to researchers. These are indicated in the folder list.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: According to an unpublished history of the College of Arts and Sciences, found in the Arts and Sciences reference folder of the University Archives:

"Early in 1942 it was generally felt that the work of the College might be greatly benefited by the existence of a standing committee, advisory or policy forming, but not legislative or executive. The committee which studied the nature of such a body stated in its report: 'To meet its responsibility the College should have a committee, more general in function than those special committees which it now has, to consider the needs and interests of the College as a whole, determining both the policies of the College in its relationship with other departments of the University and the general policy of the College itself.' The seven members elected to this 'Policy Committee of the College of Arts and Sciences' by our faculty were: Professor A.L. Kohlmeier (Chairman), P.W. Townsend, R.E. Cleland, Paul Weatherwax, L.J. Mills, J.E. Moffat, and F.P. Hall."
The Arts and Sciences Policy Committee continues to function on campus and has several areas of responsibility:

list.item: Represent the College faculty in the formulation of College policies and monitor their impact;
Advise the Dean and faculty on any matters of concern;
Make recommendations to faculty on matters requiring faculty action and to the Dean on matters that are to be handled by administrative action;
Function as the College's Budgetary Affairs Committee.

bioghist.p: The current Committee consists of nine elected tenured or tenure-track faculty members as well as the Dean and Executive Associate Dean of the College as non-voting members.
Current information and recent Committee minutes may be found on the group's web site at http://www.indiana.edu/~college/faculty/policy/index.shtml.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is organized into two series, Minutes and General files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the earliest records of the COAS Policy Committee and is organized into two series, Minutes and General files, comprising 1.6 cubic feet, spanning 1942-1998. There are no records from the 1970s.

The first series, Minutes, spans the period from 1942 to 1998. It contains, almost exclusively, recorded minutes of the Policy Committee meetings during these years. Occasional pieces of correspondence are spread throughout. (See note below regarding the 2008 addition to collection.)

The second series, General files, spans the period from 1942 to 1969 and contains a variety of documents such as correspondence between committee members and drafts of reports regarding issues such as foreign language requirements and the promotion and tenure of faculty.

In 2008, the College of Arts and Sciences transferred additional Policy Committee records to the Archives. These records arrived in binders. The material from the 1960s were labeled "Policy Committee records," organized by school year. These binders contain reports, correspondence, and minutes of the committee. Rather than break these apart, they were interfiled into the General files series. Later minutes from the 1980s and 1990s had been maintained separately from other committee records and were thus interfiled into the Minutes series.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: This collection was part of accession 0545, which also contained records of the Arts and Sciences Faculty Committee. These were separated and made into Collection C326.
